questions.q: In C++, which part of the class must be executed first when a derived class object is created?
questions.explanation: In C++, when a derived class object is created, the base class constructor is always executed first to initialize the inherited members[cite: 7, 13].

questions.q: What is invoked when using delete on an object?
questions.explanation: The delete operator is used to deallocate memory and automatically calls the object's destructor to clean up resources[cite: 17].

questions.q: What is the term for redefining a base class function in the derived class?
questions.explanation: Overriding occurs when a derived class provides a specific implementation for a function that is already defined in its base class[cite: 23].

questions.q: Which of the following is used for file input?
questions.explanation: In C++, ifstream (input file stream) is specifically used to read information from files[cite: 29].

questions.q: Which concept allows one class to reuse another class's members?
questions.explanation: Inheritance allows a new class (derived) to inherit the properties and behaviors of an existing class (base)[cite: 33].

questions.q: Which of the following is required for polymorphism?
questions.explanation: Polymorphism, specifically runtime polymorphism, requires inheritance to allow a derived class to be treated as an instance of its base class[cite: 48].

questions.q: If a base class has no constructors whatsoever, then a derived class object cannot be instance.
questions.explanation: False.  If no constructor is defined, C++ provides a default constructor automatically, allowing instantiation[cite: 77, 78].

questions.q: In a class you can have more than one constructor with the same name.
questions.explanation: True.  This is known as constructor overloading, where multiple constructors exist with different parameter lists[cite: 79].

questions.q: A derived class is often called a subclass because it represents a subset of its base class.
questions.explanation: True.  In object-oriented programming, a derived class is frequently referred to as a subclass[cite: 80].
